Name: The Eye of the World: the Graphic Novel, Volume Two (Wheel of Time Other)

ReviewList.Text: I have bought and read every single one of Robert Jordan's books and when the graphic novels came out I pre-ordered them. The graphics are really cool - the story is short. A lot is overlooked. I understand that it would be hard to remain really close and true to the initial story but I did miss the depth and suspense I encountered in the books. I would like to give it three and a half stars - mainly for the art work --. The 3.5 rating not being possible .... i am giving it a huge 3 ....

I have been a fan of the Wheel of Times series since the beginning and reading the graphic novels are quite enjoyable. Both the first and second have pretty much followed the main story line of book one, however, at the pace the graphic novels cover, I'm afraid it will take as long to cover the first book, as it did the whole series.

Our son loves the Robert Jordan series'.  He is currently serving in Afghanistan, so we have been sending him care boxes and have included books and treats.  He says that he has loved these graphic novels and thinks that the treatment is well done.  I've never read them, but he gives them a big thumbs up.
The artwork is very good and the essential elements of the story are presented perfectly.  If you're a fan of the Wheel of Time series, then this is a must buy!

I have read the entire Wheel of Time series and adore it, so being a comic book reader, I naturally wanted to pick up the graphic novel. My criticisms are that the writing on occasion seems a little stiff and it's not my favorite art. Don't get me wrong, the covers are incredible! But a good number of the inside pages seem a little rushed. Still, it's the first visual representation of this epic series and I will no doubt read them all!
Loved the books, Love the graphic novels! Great for any fan of the wheel of time books. Can't wait for more!

I love WoT and am enjoying the graphic novels. Yet, I just got this in the mail and was excitedly reading through it when I realized I'm missing pages 65-96! Since I've read the books, I know what I've missed but it was still very disappointing. I'm hoping I can return it and get a copy with all pages.
Although it is still a master piece, I've noticed the pages are thicker, the materials shorter and the price the same. Anyway, a must have for any fan of these series.
A continuation of Volume 1. The art continues to be fantastic, and the story true to Jordan's vision. I will definitely be continuing to read this series.
Loved the book series, and I am so glad that it went to graphic novel format. Can't wait for the rest of the series to come out.
If you love Robert Jordan's Eye of the World series, this is a most have for your collection.

My review is that these books all seem to run together:I decided that the graphic novel is not created to my satisfaction.  I don't like the style of the pictures.  I can say that without having ordered the book I wanted which is in the Fire and Ice series,
I don't want to have to review this because it was something my wife purchased for someone else and I've never seen it...but Amazon is making me do it.
